task.title: Working with DTD templates
task.shortdesc: Templates are a chunk of predefined code that you can insert into a DTD file when it is created. You may find a template useful when you have a certain piece of code you want to reuse several times, and you do not want to write it out every time.

context.p: To create a new DTD template, complete the following steps:

step.cmd: Click WindowPreferences Web and XMLDTD FilesTemplates .
Click New in the templates prefereces.
Supply a new template Name and Description.
Specify the Context for the template.
step.info: This is the context in which the template is available in the proposal list when content assist is requested.

step.cmd: Specify the Pattern for your template using the appropriate tags, attributes, or attribute values to be inserted by content assist.
To insert a variable, click the Insert Variable button and select a variable.
step.info: For example, the date variable indicates the current date will be inserted.

step.cmd: Click Apply and then OK to save your changes.

taskbody.postreq:
You can edit, remove, import, or export a template by using the same preferences page.
If you have a template that you do not want to remove, but you no longer want the template to appear in the DTD templates list when you create a file, clear its checkbox in the templates table.
